interview.question: Were you a little bit surprised at the way Maria played tonight? She seemed to be on form out there.
interview.answer: She played very well. I expect her to play well.

interview.question: Did she play better than you thought?
interview.answer: You know, I think I've seen her game a lot of times. I think I knew what to expect. Like I said, she played really well.

interview.question: What about your own performance? Do you feel you played poorly tonight or it was a matter of Maria playing too well?
interview.answer: Yeah, definitely not my best day today. But, you know, there's always other days to play better.

interview.question: Do these results motivate you to get back to where you were or is it a kick in of the guts because you're trying hard?
interview.answer: Honestly, every day that I practice is a day that I'm motivated to be better. Regardless of my results I want to be better, the best, the best that I can bring.

interview.question: Obviously not your A game. She was making it hard. At the end of the second set did you feel like you might be getting in there and start to turn things around?
interview.answer: Yeah, definitely. You know, one or two holds makes a big difference between 3‑All or having a break. So it's always important to take those opportunities.

interview.question: Was there anything in particular in your game that you thought was dissatisfying?
interview.answer: I just had a lot of errors. You know, that never helps.

interview.question: What is your schedule like from here to Miami?
interview.answer: Well, I'm playing doubles tomorrow, so that's definitely my focus right now. And after that, I mean, that's pretty much all I'm thinking about right now, is the doubles.

interview.question: How did you feel out there in your first round?
interview.answer: Yeah, I think in the beginning we just were getting used to playing doubles again. We hadn't played in a while. Hopefully we'll keep playing better during the tournament.

interview.question: What are some of the positives you'll take out of your singles tournament?
interview.answer: I haven't really thought about it yet. But, yeah, at this point I just feel like, you know, I'll focus on the doubles and then get ready for the next tournament. I mean, I have to wait till French Open to play another major in singles, but there will be a lot of tennis in between.

interview.question: On a non‑tennis note, did you watch any of Oprah's interview with Lance Armstrong?
Is it something that players are talking about, his confession to doping?
interview.answer: I think everyone is pretty much focused on the tennis. Maybe other players are talking about it. I have no idea.

interview.question: Do you have any reaction?
interview.answer: I can't talk about anything I don't know anything about, so I'm just going to keep my mouth shut. I'm not an expert on that stuff. That's all I can say.
